title: Watch: Man caught on camera jumping across NYC rooftop in suit and dress shoes
description: A man was caught on camera jumping across several awnings of a 23-story historic New York City building while taking no apparent safety precautions.

title: More women than ever are running for governor in the US. See what
description: A historic number of women are nominees in governors' races across the US this year. CNN's Kyung Lah breaks down the key candidates and races on the ballot.

title: Orcas hunting great white shark captured on camera for the first time
description: It is well documented that orcas are effective predators and occasionally hunt sharks, but this is the first time they have been filmed attacking a great white shark.

title: Record-setting 'monster' cat can be held like a baby, owner says
description: A Michigan house cat has been named the tallest living domestic cat in the world by Guinness World Records. Fenrir measures 18.8 inches and despite his size, his owner says the cat can be "held like a baby." CNN affiliate WDIV has more.

title: SpaceX and NASA send international astronauts to space
Ukrainian forces advance into Luhansk region for first time since Russia's invasion began
OPEC announces big cut in oil production despite US pressure
description: OPEC+ said Wednesday that it will slash oil production by 2 million barrels per day, the biggest cut since the start of the pandemic, in a move that threatens to push gasoline prices higher just weeks before US midterm elections.

title: Chris Martin's lung infection forces Coldplay to postpone shows
description: A serious illness has caused Coldplay to pause their tour.

title: Velma in new 'Scooby Doo' clip delights fans who say her LGBTQ+ identity has been confirmed
description: It appears Velma wants a same-sex boo in the an upcoming HBO Max Scooby Doo Halloween movie.

title: Aaron Judge's 62nd home run ball is valued in the region of $1-2 million, experts say
Kourtney Kardashian says she's she's not as close to Khloé as she once was
description: For anyone who watches "The Kardashians," sisters Kourtney Kardashian and Khloé Kardashian have always been tight.

title: Ryan Coogler considered quitting Hollywood after Chadwick Boseman's death
description: The death of Chadwick Boseman in 2020 following a private battle with colon cancer was a shock to many. For those closest to him, it was devastating.

title: Jim Redmond, who helped his son Derek to the finish line in 1992 Olympics, has died aged 81
description: Jim Redmond, who helped his injured son Derek across the finish line of the 400m semifinal at Barcelona 1992 in one of the Olympic Games' most poignant and iconic moments, has died at age 81, his family announced.

title: Ukraine joins Spain and Portugal's bid to host 2030 World Cup
description: Ukraine has joined Spain and Portugal's bid to host the 2030 World Cup, the Spanish Football Federation (RFEF) and the Portuguese Football Federation (FPF) said on Wednesday.

title: Alec Baldwin reaches settlement with Halyna Hutchins' family
description: The family of Halyna Hutchins, the cinematographer killed on the "Rust" movie set in 2021, and Alec Baldwin have reached an undisclosed settlement in the wrongful death lawsuit filed against the actor and others, according to a statement released by the actor's attorney.

title: Election denier Kari Lake has a real shot of winning a swing state governorship
description: One of the big questions heading into the 2022 cycle had been how Republican candidates would or not reflect the GOP base when it came to views of the 2020 election. Poll after poll has shown that a clear majority of Republicans falsely believe that President Joe Biden did not legitimately win the 2020 election.

title: Russia declines to clarify borders of illegally annexed regions
Battling obesity — and telling bullies to 'Kiss It!'
Battersea Power Station to reopen as office, shopping and restaurant hub
description: Battersea Power Station reopens next week as a glitzy hub of offices, flats, restaurants and shops after decades of failed attempts to reinvigorate one of the capital's most iconic buildings, often described as the "Everest of real estate."

title: Sleep tourism is booming. Here's why
description: Going on a vacation might seem like a rather unconventional way to try to improve your sleep habits.

title: SpaceX to launch international group of astronauts on next NASA mission
description: SpaceX and NASA are set to launch a crew of astronauts who hail from all over the world on a trip to the International Space Station.

title: 'It's kind of surreal': Key voting rights case could reshape the political power of communities of color
description: To Letetia Jackson, voting is as important as drinking water or breathing. She has her mother to thank for nourishing that conviction.

title: Paris joins growing list of French cities boycotting Qatar World Cup fan zones
description: It's likely that many French fans will be following this year's World Cup in Qatar as their team, the winner four years ago in Russia, fights to defend its title, but they won't be doing it with other football supporters in some of France's major cities' public spaces.

title: Greenpeace campaigners disrupt Liz Truss's party conference speech
West Africa bloc mediator 'satisfied' after meeting Burkina Faso new military leader
description: The mediator sent to Burkina Faso by West Africa's main political and economic bloc ECOWAS, Mahamadou Issoufou, on Tuesday said he was satisfied by a meeting with the country's new military leader Ibrahim Traore.

title: The bond market is starting to worry Wall Street
description: Persistently high inflation, the Federal Reserve's tightening policy and record-breaking US debt have wreaked havoc on US Treasuries this year.

title: See moment protesters ambush UK PM's remarks
description: Protesters from the environmental group Greenpeace disrupted an address by British Prime Minister Liz Truss at the Conservative Party conference in Birmingham, UK. This was Truss' first speech since becoming Prime Minister and came amid public backlash against the government's U-turn on new tax policy.

title: Fan who caught Aaron Judge historic home run not sure what he will do with it
description: Cory Youmans, the fan who caught New York Yankees slugger Aaron Judge's 62nd home run on Tuesday, doesn't know whether he'll keep the historic souvenir or give the ball back to Judge.

title: Greenpeace campaigners disrupt Liz Truss's party conference speech
description: Protesters from the environmental group Greenpeace were ejected from the Conservative Party conference on Wednesday after disrupting British Prime Minister Liz Truss's first speech as leader.

title: Miss Crimea fined by Russia for singing patriotic Ukrainian song
description: A beauty queen who was named Miss Crimea 2022 has been fined 40,000 Russian rubles (around $680) by occupying Russian authorities for singing the patriotic Ukrainian song "Chervona Kalyna," according to Russian state media and pro-Russian regional authorities.

title: Asian economies are in trouble but a 1997-style crisis is unlikely
description: A quarter of a century ago, a major financial crisis ripped through Asia, shaking its economies to the core. Now, the ghost of 1997 is haunting the region again.

title: Three scientists win Nobel Prize for chemistry for 'ingenious' molecule-building tool
description: Carolyn R. Bertozzi, Morten Meldal and K. Barry Sharpless have won the Nobel Prize for chemistry, for creating "an ingenious tool for building molecules."

title: Russia concedes big losses in south as pro-Putin voices paint a grim picture of setbacks
A barrier of fear has been broken in Iran. The regime may be at a point of no return
description: • Missing out on playing in the World Cup is 'worth sacrificing for one strand of Iranian women's hair'

title: Russia concedes big losses as pro-Putin voices paint grim picture
description: Russian forces appear to be buckling under growing pressure as Ukraine continues to regain territory in the south, where Russian soldiers have been forced to retreat from previously-held settlements as Kyiv progresses with its counteroffensive towards the Russian-occupied city of Kherson.

title: 90% of US adults say mental health is in crisis in the United States, CNN/KFF poll finds
description: An overwhelming majority of people in the United States think the country is experiencing a mental health crisis, according to a new survey from CNN in partnership with the Kaiser Family Foundation.

title: Tanks, Apaches, and drones. See South Korea's state-of-the-art weapons
description: South Korea aims to become one of the world's top four military equipment suppliers, President Yoon Suk Yeol announced. CNN's Paula Hancocks travels to some of the country's biggest arms manufacturers to find out how close the country is to realizing its ambition.

title: Residents of Florida island cut off by Ian are set to return to survey 'unlivable' homes
Search continues for abducted California family as officials release new timeline on their disappearance
description: The search for a family of four kidnapped in California continues Wednesday after authorities took a person of interest into custody and released new details about the case Tuesday.

title: The security risk Congress needs to take seriously
description: Football watch parties saw unexpected interruptions recently when low flying drones over the gridiron forced NFL and college football games to stop. In both instances, the drones flew away without incident and there was no risk to fans attending, but each demonstrates the potential public safety threat unmanned aircraft systems (UAS) or "drones" pose to the public, and the need for tools to address it.

title: China bans residents from leaving Xinjiang, just weeks after its last Covid lockdown
description: China has banned residents from leaving Xinjiang over a Covid-19 outbreak -- just weeks after the far-western region began relaxing restrictions from a stringent extended lockdown, fueling public frustration among those scarred by food shortages and plunging incomes.

title: 2% of the world's rarest zebras wiped out in Kenya's relentless drought
description: A grueling two-year drought in Kenya has wiped out 2% of the world's rarest zebra species and increased elephant deaths as well, as the climate crisis takes its toll on the east African nation's wildlife.

title: 'Even Maradona would have been proud,' says coach as Napoli thrashes Ajax 6-1 in Champions League
description: Napoli coach Luciano Spalletti invoked the memory of club legend Diego Maradona after watching his side thrash Ajax 6-1 in the Champions League on Tuesday.

title: How the Supreme Court's liberal justices sought to shape voting-rights arguments
description: The Supreme Court's three liberal justices -- Latina, White and Black women -- sought during voting-rights arguments Tuesday to wrench the narrative of a colorblind America from the conservatives who currently dominate the bench.

title: Missing out on playing in the World Cup is 'worth sacrificing for one strand of Iranian women's hair'
description: The World Cup in Qatar is practically a home tournament for Iran, only the narrow Persian Gulf separates the two nations.

title: US and South Korea test-fire missiles in continued response after North Korea launch
Miss Crimea fined by Russia for singing patriotic Ukrainian song
When you eat may dictate how hungry you are, study says
description: We all know that eating later in the day isn't good for our waistlines, but why? A new study weighed in on that question by comparing people who ate the same foods -- but at different times in the day.

title: Survivors recount horror of Indonesia stadium tragedy as officials say locked exits contributed to crush
description: Fans attempting to escape the chaos that erupted at Indonesia's Kanjuruhan Stadium last Saturday became trapped after security failed to open multiple exit gates, according to the national football association, contributing to the crowd crush in which at least 131 people died.

title: This solar-powered electric car cleans carbon from the air as it drives
description: Silver, sleek and sporty, Zem wouldn't look out of place at a supercar championship. But Zem isn't like other sports cars -- or any car, for that matter.

title: Judge dismisses charges against top former state officials in Flint water crisis
description: A judge has dismissed charges against seven former top Michigan state officials for their alleged role in the Flint water crisis, ruling that the charges weren't valid due to a procedural error.

title: Iconic toy goes to space to inspire girls to work in science
description: To mark the first day of World Space Week, Europe's first female commander of the International Space Station Samantha Cristoforetti has spoken from space alongside the 'Barbie astronaut' modeled on herself. Cristoforetti took questions from young girls back on earth as part of an effort to inspire girls to consider careers in science. CNN's Isa Soares reports.

title: Avalanche kills at least 4 mountaineers in Indian Himalayas
description: At least four people were killed and 28 people remain missing after an avalanche hit a group of mountaineers in the Indian Himalayas on Tuesday, according to an Indian mountaineering organization.

title: The killings of 6 people in central California all happened in dark areas where surveillance cameras were scant. Here's what we know
description: Authorities in California's Central Valley are investigating what they believe is a series of killings that has claimed the lives of six people since last year.

title: Kyiv's forces have made gains in the eastern Luhansk region and in Kherson in the south. More areas are being liberated "every day," a Ukrainian official said.
Ukrainian forces recapture territory in the south and east
Teenage grandmaster 'likely cheated' in dozens of matches, top site claims
description: Teenage chess grandmaster Hans Niemann "likely cheated" in more than 100 online matches, including ones with prize money involved, according to an investigation by one of the sport's most popular websites.

title: 'It is going to be emotional': Residents of Florida island cut off from the mainland by Hurricane Ian are set to return to survey 'unlivable' homes
description: A week after Hurricane Ian slammed into Florida, residents of one of its barrier islands will be allowed to return to view their homes Wednesday for the first time since the storm devastated the once tranquil community.

title: Aaron Judge breaks single-season American League home run record with No. 62
description: New York Yankees slugger Aaron Judge broke Roger Maris' single-season American League home run record, hitting his 62nd blast of the year in a game Tuesday against the Texas Rangers.

title: Retired colonel calls this move by Ukrainians 'significant'
description: Retired Air Force Col. Cedric Leighton tells CNN's Don Lemon why Ukrainian military advances in the south and east are important in the fight against Russia.

title: US Navy's most advanced aircraft carrier deploys
description: The US Navy's newest and most advanced aircraft carrier left on its first deployment Tuesday from Norfolk, Virginia, designed to put the ship through its paces and exercise with allies in North America and Europe.

title: US and South Korea test-fire missiles in continued response after North Korea launch
description: • North Korea fired a missile over Japan. Experts say it's a sign of what's to come

title: Elon Musk again proposes buying Twitter at full price
Is the Musk Twitter deal back on?! Here are the winners and losers
description: In a big reversal, Elon Musk has proposed buying Twitter at the original price. Here's who stands to gain and lose if the deal goes through.

title: Brad Pitt's rep calls Angelina Jolie's latest allegations 'completely untrue'
description: A countersuit filed Tuesday by actress Angelina Jolie against her ex-husband Brad Pitt includes more information about an alleged physical altercation between the former couple that took place on a plane in 2016.

title: Hear what Trump told Haberman about Ron DeSantis
description: New York Times reporter Maggie Haberman discusses what former President Donald Trump told her about the political rise of Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis and the possibility of DeSantis running against him for the 2024 GOP nomination.

title: The world's best bars for 2022 have been revealed
description: Move over London. Step aside New York. There's a new cosmopolitan cocktail capital: Barcelona is home to Paradiso, the newly crowned world's best bar.
